data.event: Jefferson County is Arkansas's 21st county, formed on November 2, 1829, from portions of Arkansas and Pulaski counties, and named for Thomas Jefferson, third President of the United States.
In March 1819, Robert Crittenden was appointed secretary of Arkansas Territory.

event.title: Several years later, James Scull, also from Arkansas Post, established

data.event: Several years later, James Scull, also from Arkansas Post, established a tavern and small inn on the river's north bank, across from what would become the site of Pine Bluff.
